test suite.name: SA
test suite.description: All the test available for this entity

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain correct value for organization_type claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the value of the organization_type claim can be 'public' or 'private'

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain correct value for organization_type claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the value of the organization_type claim can be 'public' or 'private'

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the contacts parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'contacts' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the federation_fetch_endpoint parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'federation_fetch_endpoint' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the federation_list_endpoint parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'federation_list_endpoint' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the federation_resolve_endpoint parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'federation_resolve_endpoint' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the federation_trust_mark_status_endpoint parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'federation_trust_mark_status_endpoint' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the homepage_uri parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'homepage_uri' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the logo_uri parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'logo_uri' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the organization_name parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'organization_name' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the SA's metadata contain the policy_uri parameter
test.description: In this test the SA metadata are taken and the presence of the 'policy_uri' parameter inside the 'federation_entity' metadata type is checked.

test.name: Does the Entity Statement's JWT payload contain a correct 'iss' claim
test.description: This test can be performed by taking the JWT present in the Entity Statement Response, base64url decoding the payload and checking the iss claim. Its value must be an URL identifying the SA

test.name: Does the Entity Statement's JWT payload contain a correct 'iss' claim
test.description: This test can be performed by taking the JWT present in the Entity Statement Response, base64url decoding the payload and checking the iss claim. Its value must be an URL identifying the SA

test.name: Does the entity return a correct Content-Type in the EC response
test.description: In this test a correct request to the entity's /.well-known/openid-federation endpoint is made and the response is analyzed. It must have a Content-Type parameter set to application/entity-statement+jwt

test.name: Does the entity return a correct HTTP code in the EC response
test.description: In this test a correct request to the entity's /.well-known/openid-federation endpoint is made and the response is analyzed. It must be an HTTP 200 OK response

test.name: Does the Entity expose the /.well-known/openid-federation endpoint
test.description: In order to check the presence and correctness of the /.well-known/openid-federation endpoint, an HTTP GET request to the entity's endpoint is done and its entity configuration is expected as response.

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct claims claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) must be taken, decrypted and the value of the claims claim is checked to be a list

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain the correct type of email claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the email claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain the exp type
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the exp claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the id_code claim of a Trust Mark issued for private organization contain the fiscal_number or vat_number claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for a private entity must be taken, decrypted and the presence of the fiscal_number or vat_number claim in the id_code is checked

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain the correct iat type
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the iat claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain correcty type of id_code claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the value of the id_code claim must be a JSON Object

test.name: Does the id_code claim of a Trust Mark issued by an SA for public organization contain the ipa_code claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for a public entity must be taken, decrypted and the presence of the id_code claim contains at least the value 'ipa_code'

test.name: Does the id_code claim of a Trust Mark issued by an SA for public organization contain a correct type of 'ipa_code' claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for a public entity must be taken, decrypted and the type of the value of the 'ipa_code' in the id_code claim is checked. It has to be a string

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain a correct iss claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the iss claim in it is checked. Its value has to be an URL

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain correct type of logo_uri claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the value of the logo_uri claim is an URL

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain the correct type of organization_name claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the organization_name claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct policy_uri claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) must be taken, decrypted and the policy_uri claim in it is checked. Its value has to be an URL

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain an URL in the ref claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the ref claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the issued intermediary Trust Mark contain a correct sa_profile claim
test.description: A Trust Mark issued for an SA is taken, decrypted and the value of the sa_profile claim can be 'full' or 'light'

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct service_documentation claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) is taken and the service_documentation claim is checked to be an URL

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain a correct sub claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the sub claim in it is checked. Its value has to be an URL

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct tos_uri claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) must be taken, decrypted and the tos_uri claim is checked to be an URL

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct claims claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) must be taken, decrypted and the value of the claims claim is checked to be a list

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain the correct type of the email claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the email claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain the exp type
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the exp claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the id_code claim of a Trust Mark issued for private organization contain the fiscal_number or vat_number claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for a private entity must be taken, decrypted and the presence of the fiscal_number or vat_number claim in the id_code is checked

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain the correct iat type
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the iat claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain correcty type of id_code claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the value of the id_code claim must be a JSON Object

test.name: Does the id_code claim of a Trust Mark issued by an SA for public organization contain the ipa_code claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for a public entity must be taken, decrypted and the presence of the id_code claim contains at least the value 'ipa_code'

test.name: Does the id_code claim of a Trust Mark issued by an SA for public organization contain a correct type of 'ipa_code' claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for a public entity must be taken, decrypted and the type of the value of the 'ipa_code' in the id_code claim is checked. It has to be a string

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain a correct iss claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the iss claim in it is checked. Its value has to be an URL

test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the value of the logo_uri claim is an URL

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct policy_uri claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) must be taken, decrypted and the policy_uri claim in it is checked. Its value has to be an URL

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain an URL in the ref claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the type of the ref claim in it is checked.

test.name: Does the issued intermediary Trust Mark contain a correct sa_profile claim
test.description: A Trust Mark issued for an SA is taken, decrypted and the value of the sa_profile claim can be 'full' or 'light'

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct service_documentation claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) is taken and the service_documentation claim is checked to be an URL

test.name: Does the Trust Mark contain a correct sub claim
test.description: In this test, an issued Trust Mark must be taken, decrypted and the sub claim in it is checked. Its value has to be an URL

test.name: Does the issued oauth_resource Trust Mark contain a correct tos_uri claim
test.description: In this test, a Trust Mark issued for an AA (oauth_resource profile) must be taken, decrypted and the tos_uri claim is checked to be an URL

test.name: Does the SA correctly sign the Trust marks
test.description: To accomplish this test, an entity statement issued by the SA is taken, and the trust marks in it are taken. The three parts of the JWT (header, payload and signature) composing the trust marks are base64url decoded. Finally, the signature is validated passing the public key (n, e of jwks parameter), the JWS Signature (received signature base64url decoded) and the JWS signing input (header and payload base64url encoded and concatenated with a dot dividing them) to a signature verifier.

test.name: Does the SA correctly sign the Trust marks
test.description: To accomplish this test, an entity statement issued by the SA is taken, and the trust marks in it are taken. The three parts of the JWT (header, payload and signature) composing the trust marks are base64url decoded. Finally, the signature is validated passing the public key (n, e of jwks parameter), the JWS Signature (received signature base64url decoded) and the JWS signing input (header and payload base64url encoded and concatenated with a dot dividing them) to a signature verifier.

test.name: Does the entity correctly sign the Entity Configuration
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken and the three parts of the JWT (header, payload and signature) are base64url decoded. Finally, the signature is validated passing the public key (n, e of jwks parameter that must be taken from the Entity Statement of a superior), the JWS Signature (received signature base64url decoded) and the JWS signing input (header and payload base64url encoded and concatenated with a dot dividing them) to a signature verifier configured for the algorithm described in the Entity Configuration Header

test.name: Does the SA correctly signs the Entity Statement
test.description: In order to validate the signature of an Entity statement issued by an SA, the statement is taken and the three parts of the JWT (header, payload and signature) are base64url decoded. Finally, the signature is validated passing the public key (n, e of jwks parameter of the Entity Statement of the SA issued from the TA), the JWS Signature (received signature base64url decoded) and the JWS signing input (header and payload base64url encoded and concatenated with a dot dividing them) to a signature verifier configured for the algorithm described in the Entity Statement Header

test.name: Does the SA correctly signs the Entity Statement
test.description: In order to validate the signature of an Entity statement issued by an SA, the statement is taken and the three parts of the JWT (header, payload and signature) are base64url decoded. Finally, the signature is validated passing the public key (n, e of jwks parameter of the Entity Statement of the SA issued from the TA), the JWS Signature (received signature base64url decoded) and the JWS signing input (header and payload base64url encoded and concatenated with a dot dividing them) to a signature verifier configured for the algorithm described in the Entity Statement Header

test.name: Does entity configuration contain the exp parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the presence of the exp parameter is checked

test.name: Does entity configuration contain the iat parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the presence of the iat parameter is checked

test.name: Does entity configuration contain the iss parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the presence of the iss parameter is checked

test.name: Does entity configuration contain the jwks parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the presence of the jwks parameter is checked

test.name: Does entity configuration contain the metadata parameter

test.name: Does entity configuration contain the sub parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the presence of the sub parameter is checked

test.name: Does the entity configuration of the SA contain the trust marks
test.description: The entity configuration of the SA is taken from its own web endpoint '.well-known/openid-federation', and the metadata in the response are analyzed. Among them, the 'trust_marks' parameter must be present.

test.name: Does Entity Statements issued by the SA contain the constraints parameter
test.description: In order to check if the SA issues correct Entity statements, a request for an entity statement is made (HTTP GET request in the SA's fetch endpoint) and the response is analyzed. Therefore, the Entity Statement Payload contained in the response are base64url decoded, once obtained the decrypted Payload, the presence if the constraints parameter is checked

test.name: Does Entity Statements issued by the SA contain the exp parameter
test.description: In order to check if the SA issues correct Entity statements, a request for an entity statement is made (HTTP GET request in the TA's fetch endpoint) and the response is analyzed. test.name: Does the entity configuration of a considered entity return a Federation Metadata in JOSE format when an HTTP GET request is made to its .well-known/openid-federation endpoint
test.description: The considered entity must have published its entity configuration in the .well-known/openid-federation endpoint. So in this test, an HTTP GET request is made to the entity's .well-known/openid-federation endpoint (appended to the URL which identifies the entity) and the response is analyzed. This response has to be the entity configuration of the entity and therefore a Federation Metadata in JOSE format (Content-Type: application/entity-statement+jwt)

test.name: Does the Entity expose the resolve entity statement endpoint
test.description: In order to check the presence and correctness of the resolve entity statement endpoint, an HTTP GET request containing the parameters 'sub', 'anchor' and 'type' is made to the entity's endpoint and an HTTP 200 OK response containing the resolved metadata for the entity in the request's sub claim is expected.

test.name: Does the Entity expose the entity listing endpoint
test.description: In order to check the presence and correctness of the resolve entity statement endpoint, an HTTP GET request entity's endpoint. An HTTP 200 OK response containing a JSON list with the known Entity Identifiers is expected

test.name: Does the SA correctly release the Entity statements
test.description: After a correct onboarding with the SA, it must publish the entity statement for the subordinate entity in its fetch endpoint. So, in this test, once correctly registered an Entity, an HTTP GET request is made to the SA's fetch endpoint, with the request containing the Entity identifier. The response is then checked and it must contain the subordinate entity's Entity Statement.

test.name: Does the SA correctly release the Entity statements
test.description: After a correct onboarding with the SA, it must publish the entity statement for the subordinate entity in its fetch endpoint. So, in this test, once correctly registered an Entity, an HTTP GET request is made to the SA's fetch endpoint, with the request containing the Entity identifier. The response is then checked and it must contain the subordinate entity's Entity Statement.

test.name: Does the Entity expose the fetch entity statement endpoint
test.description: In order to check the presence and correctness of the fetch entity statement endpoint, an HTTP GET request containing the parameters 'iss' and 'sub' is made to the entity's endpoint and a response containing the resolved metadata for the entity in the request's sub claim is expected.

operations.message type: Fetch Entity Statement response SA RP

test.name: Does the metadata parameter contain only allowed types
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource'

test.name: Does entity configuration contain a correct exp parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the presence of the exp parameter is checked

test.name: Does entity configuration contain a correct iat parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the presence of the iat parameter is checked

test.name: Does the metadata parameter contain a JSON Object
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object.

test.name: Does the TA metadata contain correct type logo_uri claim
test.description: In this test the SA metadata in the TA Entity Configuration are taken and the value of the logo_uri claim in the 'federation_entity' entity type is an URL with an .svg file

test.name: Does the entity configuration of the SA contain a correct trust_marks parameter
test.description: The entity configuration of the SA is taken from its own web endpoint '.well-known/openid-federation', and the configuration metadata are analyzed. Among them, the 'trust_marks' parameter must be present and must be a JSON array containing the Trust Marks.

test.name: Does Entity Statements issued by the SA contain a correct exp parameter
test.description: In order to check if the SA issues correct Entity statements, a request for an entity statement is made (HTTP GET request in the TA's fetch endpoint) and the response is analyzed. Therefore, the Entity Statement Payload contained in the response is base64url decoded and once obtained the decrypted Payload, the the exp parameter is checked. It must be a timestamp

test.name: Does Entity Statements issued by the SA contain a correct iat parameter
test.description: In order to check if the SA issues correct Entity statements, a request for an entity statement is made (HTTP GET request in the TA's fetch endpoint) and the response is analyzed. Therefore, the Entity Statement Payload contained in the response is base64url decoded and once obtained the decrypted Payload, the the iat parameter is checked. It must be a timestamp

test.name: Does Entity Statements issued by the SA contain a correct exp parameter
test.description: In order to check if the SA issues correct Entity statements, a request for an entity statement is made (HTTP GET request in the TA's fetch endpoint) and the response is analyzed. Therefore, the Entity Statement Payload contained in the response is base64url decoded and once obtained the decrypted Payload, the the exp parameter is checked. It must be a timestamp

test.name: Does Entity Statements issued by the SA contain a correct iat parameter
test.description: In order to check if the SA issues correct Entity statements, a request for an entity statement is made (HTTP GET request in the TA's fetch endpoint) and the response is analyzed. Therefore, the Entity Statement Payload contained in the response is base64url decoded and once obtained the decrypted Payload, the the iat parameter is checked. It must be a timestamp

test.name: Does the SA's metadata policy for an RP contain the jwks parameter
test.description: In order to check the compliance of a metadata policy issued by the SA, an entity statement for an RP must be fetched in the SA's fetch endpoint. Once obtained the entity statement, the metadata_policy parameter is taken and the presence of the jwks parameter inside the openid_relying_party type is checked. It must contain the RP JWKS related to the OIDC Core operations

test.name: Does the metadata parameter contain only allowed types and only once for each
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the metadata parameter is analyzed. This must be a JSON object with each key representing a type of metadata. These types cannot be repeated and must be a value among the following: 'openid_relying_party', 'openid_provider', 'federation_entity', 'oauth_authorization_server', 'oauth_resource'

test.name: Does entity configuration OP contain a correct sub parameter
test.description: To accomplish this test, the Entity configuration of the interested entity is taken, the payload is decoded (Base64 encoding) and the sub parameter is checked. Its value must be equal to the one in the iss parameter
